messages.content: You are a data analyst showing data to the general public. Choose a parameter (e.g., temperature, pressure, relative humidity…). Consider a table consisting of two columns: month and measured values of the chosen parameter. In the column of measured values, find the highest value. Once found, read the corresponding month in the other column. Return this month as the output.If the highest value appears in multiple cells, return all the corresponding months as the output.
On which month of the year Y was the highest value of the examined parameter recorded for station AL007?
The highest value was recorded on month X of year Y.

You are a data analyst showing data to the general public. Choose a parameter (e.g., temperature, pressure, relative humidity…). Consider a table consisting of one column: the measured values of the chosen parameter. First, find the highest value, then the lowest. After finding them, calculate the difference using the formula: maximum value - minimum value = result. Return this result as the output. If the highest and lowest values appear multiple times, consider each only once.
By how much do the maximum and minimum values of the examined parameter differ in year Y for station AL007?
The maximum and minimum values differ by X units.

You are a data analyst showing data to the general public. Consider the parameter temperature. Consider a table consisting of one column: the measured temperature values. Search and count all the measured values below 0°C. Return the total number of values below 0°C as the result.
How many times did the temperature drop below 0°C at station AL007 in year Y?
The temperature dropped below 0°C X times in year Y.

You are a data analyst showing data to the general public. Choose a parameter (e.g., temperature, pressure, relative humidity…). Consider a table consisting of one column: the measured values of the chosen parameter. Count how many measured values are present in the table. Sum all the measured values in the table. Apply the following formula: total sum of values / number of values = result. Return this result as the output.
What is the average annual value of the examined parameter in year Y for station AL007?
The average annual value of the parameter in year Y is X.

You are a data analyst showing data to the general public. Choose a parameter (e.g., temperature, pressure, relative humidity…). Consider a table consisting of one column: the measured values of the chosen parameter. Count how many times each measured value appears in the table. The value that appears the most is the result.
What was the most frequent value (mode) of the examined parameter in year Y for station AL007?
The most frequent value of the parameter in year Y was X.

You are a data analyst showing data to the general public. Choose a parameter (e.g., temperature, pressure, relative humidity…). Consider a table consisting of one column: the measured values of the chosen parameter.Count how many measured values are present in the table. Obtain the number of missing measurements using the formula:(48 × 366) – number of measured values = result Where: 48 = number of measurements per day (1 every 30 minutes) and 366 = number of days in year Y. Return this result as the output.
In year Y, how many measurements of the examined parameter were not recorded due to technical issues with station AL007?
The number of measurements not recorded due to technical issues was X in year Y.

You are a data analyst showing data to the general public. Choose a parameter (e.g., temperature, pressure, relative humidity…). Consider a table consisting of two columns: month and measured values of the chosen parameter. In the column of measured values, find the lowest value. Once found, read the corresponding month in the other column. Return this month as the output. If the lowest value appears in multiple cells, return all the corresponding months as the output.
On which month of the year Y was the lowest value of the examined parameter recorded for station AL007?
The lowest value was recorded on month X of year Y.

You are a data analyst showing data to the general public. Choose a parameter (e.g., temperature, pressure, relative humidity…). For 2023: consider a table consisting of one column: the measured values of the chosen parameter. Count how many measured values are in the table.Sum all the values. Apply the formula:total sum / number of values = result 1. For 2024: repeat the same procedure to obtain result 2. Then apply the formula: result 2 – result 1 = result. Return this result as the output.
By how much has the average value of the examined parameter changed over the last two years (2023 and 2024) for station AL007?
The average value changed by X units between 2023 and 2024.

You are a data analyst showing data to the general public. Choose a parameter (e.g., temperature, pressure, relative humidity…). Consider a table consisting of one column: the measured values of the chosen parameter. Sort the measured values in ascending order. Count the number of measured values. If the number of values is odd, calculate the median using this method: total values / 2 = number point five Round number point five up to the next integer = result 1. Find the value in the result 1 position of the sorted list. That value is the output. If the number of values is even: total values / 2 = result 2. Find the values at positions result 2 and result 2 + 1 in the sorted list. Sum the two values and divide by 2. That result is the median and the output.
When ordering the dataset of the examined parameter in ascending order, what is the median value for year Y for station AL007?
The median value of the parameter in year Y is X.

You are a data analyst showing data to the general public. Choose a parameter (e.g., temperature, pressure, relative humidity…). Consider a table consisting of two columns: month and measured values of the chosen parameter. For each month, find the maximum and minimum values of the chosen parameter and calculate their difference: maximum – minimum = result. The month with the highest result represents the greatest discrepancy and is the required output.
In which month of year Y does the examined parameter show the greatest discrepancy between its maximum and minimum values for station AL007?
The month with the greatest discrepancy is X.
